sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 4}. Find the set (A×B) △ B and compare it with (A △ B) × B. Is the result the same or different? Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference using this example.
